result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shelly N. Tomlinson

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 3:31 pm 
INCLUDES 19CF69, 16CF80, 15CF743, 15CF628, 15CF302, AND 14CM992. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Wright Laufenberg. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 19CF69: Cts. 3, 4, 6, & 7>>D&RI. 
In 16CF80: Cts. 3, 4, & 6>>D&RI. 
In 15CF743: Cts. 1-3>>D&RI. 
In 15CF628: Cts. 1-3>>D&RI. 
In 15CF302: Cts 1 & 2>>DISMISS WITHOUT PREJUDICE. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 19CF69: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                  : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                  : Ct. 5 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 16CF80: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                  : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                  : Ct. 5 (Resisting an Officer)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CM992: Ct. 1 (Misd. Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
                     : Ct. 2 (Misd. Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
                     : Ct. 3 (Misd. Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 19CF69: Ct. 1>>SWH for 5 yrs probation. 
                  : Ct. 2>>SWH for 5 yrs probation. 
                  : Ct. 5>>SWH for 5 yrs probation - CONDITION: 6 months MCJ with 36 days jail credit. 
In 16CF80: Ct. 1>>SWH for 5 yrs probation. 
                  : Ct. 2>>SWH for 5 yrs probation. 
                  : Ct. 5>>SWH for 2 yrs probation. 
In 14CM992: Ct. 1>>SWH for 2 yrs probation. 
                     : Ct. 2>>SWH for 2 yrs probation. 
                     : Ct. 3>>SWH for 2 yrs probation. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation on ALL>>AODA unless agent decides that is not necessary; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file). 

COURT finds the def entitled to 222 days jail credit in 16CF80 & 119 days jail credit in 14CM992 if revoked. 
COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
Adj: 3:52 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 14, 2019 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on May 3, 2019 at 11:00 am.
Parties working with Taylor County toward settlement
Status conference on March 29, 2019 at 09:15 am.
